IPDR_tag_SocketEvent Struct Reference

#include <GenericPlatform.h>

IPDR_SocketHandle FD

Detailed Description

A socket callback event.
See also:
IPDR_RegisterReadSocket_t

IPDR_RegisterWriteSocket_t

Field Documentation

void* IPDR_tag_SocketEvent::Arg
 

The context argument to IPDR_RegisterReadSocket_t or IPDR_RegisterWriteSocket_t.

IPDR_SocketCallback_t IPDR_tag_SocketEvent::Callback
 

The callback as given to IPDR_RegisterReadSocket_t or IPDR_RegisterWriteSocket_t.

IPDR_SocketHandle IPDR_tag_SocketEvent::FD
 

The file (socket) descriptor.

struct IPDR_tag_SocketEvent* IPDR_tag_SocketEvent::NextEvent
 

Next in the chain of events.

volatile IPDR_BOOL IPDR_tag_SocketEvent::Unregistered
 

The Unregistered flag is used to allow freeing "FDEvent" when it is no longer needed. To synchronize everything, the freeing is done only when the events are processed. This is marked as "volatile" because one thread can set it and another thread looks at its value.
